workspace.title: Workspaces
workspace.description: Array of local workspaces. These should be absolute, valid paths. Linux/OSX paths should include a leading slash, Windows paths should include the drive and escaped backslashes. A trailing slash is permitted, but unnecessary.

api_version.title: Salesforce API Version
api_version.description: The API version you would like to use when accessing the Salesforce APIs.

compile_check_conflicts.title: Check conflicts before compile
compile_check_conflicts.description: Set to true to check for conflicts when compiling Apex/Visualforce metadata.

download_categorized_test_logs.title: Download categorized Apex unit test logs
download_categorized_test_logs.description: Set to true to download Apex unit test logs to your project"s debug/<test-name>/ directory

polling_interval.title: Polling interval, in milliseconds
polling_interval.description: Set to a higher number if you are consistently hitting Salesforce API limits (note: a higher polling interval means you will wait longer for compilation, deploy, and test results).

default_subscription.title: Default metadata subscription
default_subscription.description: Array of metadata types that should be included in every new MavensMate project, e.g. ApexClass, ApexPage, CustomObject, StaticResource

ignore_managed_metadata.title: Ignore managed metadata
ignore_managed_metadata.description: Set to true to prevent managed metadata from being downloaded to your MavensMate projects

use_keyring.title: Use keyring
use_keyring.description: Set to true if you would like MavensMate to use your machine's keychain support to store/retrieve Salesforce.com credentials. If set to false, MavensMate will store passwords in plain text in your project's config/.settings and config/.org_connections files.

compile_with_tooling_api.title: Compile Apex/Visualforce metadata with Tooling API
compile_with_tooling_api.description: Set to true to use the tooling api to compile apex metadata (if you're experiencing compile issues, set this to false to use the metadata api)

legacy_unzip.title: (Advanced) Use your machine's `unzip` cli to unzip responses from Salesforce.com Metadata API
legacy_unzip.description: Set to true *ONLY* if MavensMate is having difficulty unzipping responses from the Salesforce.com Metadata API (you will have seen ENOENT/EPERM errors referencing a missing 'unpackaged' directory).

subl_location.title: Sublime Text location
subl_location.description: The full path of your Sublime Text executable (Sublime Text users only).

atom_exec_path.title: Atom executable location
atom_exec_path.description: The full path to atom executable (Atom users only).

vscode_exec_path.title: Visual Studio Code executable location
vscode_exec_path.description: The full path to Visual Studio 'code' executable (Visual Studio Code users only).

log_location.title: MavensMate logs location
log_location.description: Full path to the location where you would like MavensMate to store its logs. When this and log_level are set, MavensMate will write logs to this path with the file name mavensmate.log. Relevant logs should be included with any bug reports.

log_level.title: Plugin log level
log_level.description: Possible values: INFO, WARN, DEBUG, VERBOSE, SILLY

play_sounds.title: Play sounds
play_sounds.description: Set to true if you would like MavensMate to play notification sounds on events like deployments, unit tests, etc.

template_location.title: MavensMate templates location
template_location.description: Possible values: remote or local. Set to 'remote' when templates should be sourced from GitHub. Set to 'local' if you have cloned MavensMate-Templates locally and wish to source templates from your local file system.

template_source.title: MavensMate template source
template_source.description: If 'template_location' is set to 'local', set this to the absolute location of the directory where you've forked the MavensMate-Templates project. Project structure must be in the format found here: https://github.com/MagisterAmica/MavensMate-Templates. If 'template_location' is set to 'remote', set to github location ('username/reponame/branchname').

apex_file_extensions.title: Salesforce file extensions
apex_file_extensions.description: Array of file extensions that should be considered 'Salesforce' file extensions.

http_proxy.title: HTTP Proxy
http_proxy.description: Set if you are behind a proxy (you can also set via export HTTP_PROXY, export HTTPS_PROXY). Example: http://10.10.1.10:3128 or http://user:pass@10.10.1.10:3128/

https_proxy.title: HTTPS Proxy
https_proxy.description: Set if you are behind a proxy (you can also set via export HTTP_PROXY, export HTTPS_PROXY). Example: http://10.10.1.10:3128 or http://user:pass@10.10.1.10:3128/

purge_on_delete.title: Purge on delete
purge_on_delete.description: Set to true to perform a hard delete when deleting metadata.

legacy_compile.title: Use legacy compile method
legacy_compile.description: Set to true to perform a retrieve via the metadata API after Apex/VF compilation. Only set to true if you are having trouble compiling.

oauth_client_id.title: OAuth Client Id
oauth_client_id.description: If present, overrides the built-in MaventMate client id.
